comment.text: Information is based on database description. Actual diagnose is missing
Other clinical features: significant enteroviral infection

consequence.term: point mutation in the exon 3 leading to a premature stop codon in the CH4 domain

comment.text: Information is based on database description. Actual diagnose is missing
Infections: Bacterial: pneumonia Other clinical features: Pseudomonas sepsis, neutropenia, failure to thrive, diarrhea, otitis, arthritis

consequence.term: deletion in the exon 2 leading to a premature stop codon in the CH3 domain
deletion may be as well g.739_740delAA, c.1037_1038delAA

comment.text: Information is based on database description. Actual diagnose is missing
Other clinical features: Pseudomonas sepsis, diarrhea, conjunctivitis, bronchiectasis

consequence.term: deletion in the exon 2 leading to a premature stop codon in the CH3 domain

comment.text: Information is based on database description. Actual diagnose is missing

consequence.term: point mutation in the exon 4 leading to an amino acid change

comment.text: Other clinical features: chronic enteroviral encephalitis, mental retardation

consequence.term: point mutation in the exon 4 leading to an amino acid change

the change would cause a substitution of S for G in the secreted form of the mu chain, or K would be substituted for the wild type E in the membrane form, or loss of the consensus G at the -1 position would be expected to markedly reduce efficient splicing

comment.text: Other clinical features: bronchopneumonia and gastroenteritis at seven months of age

consequence.term: point mutation in the exon 4 leading to an amino acid change

the change would cause a substitution of S for G in the secreted form of the mu chain, or K would be substituted for the wild type E in the membrane form, or loss of the consensus G at the -1 position would be expected to markedly reduce efficient splicing
point mutation in the exon 4 leading to an amino acid change

the change would cause a substitution of S for G in the secreted form of the mu chain, or K would be substituted for the wild type E in the membrane form, or loss of the consensus G at the -1 position would be expected to markedly reduce efficient splicing

comment.text: Information is based on database description. Actual diagnose is missing
Infections: Bacterial: pneumonia Other clinical features: Enteroviral infection, neutropenia

consequence.term: point mutation in the exon 4 leading to an amino acid change
This alteration would change the G at this codon to S in the secreted form of mu heavy chain and K to E in the membrane form of the molecule
